body_text:
Currently enabled is a property of a recipe, independent of all revisions. This mostly means that we have no way to track when a recipe was enabled and disabled, which is a problem for data analysis. This is a big problem, and not easy to fix.
The way I imagine this, we'll need to make enabled a property of RecipeRevision objects, instead of Recipe objects. This makes a lot of the workflows around enabling/disabling a recipe and signing much more complicated. I think that moving Signatures to be per-revision will also be necessary to make this work, but I'm not sure.

title: Track enabled through version history
body:
Currently enabled is a property of a recipe, independent of all revisions. This mostly means that we have no way to track *when* a recipe was enabled and disabled, which is a problem for data analysis. This is a big problem, and not easy to fix.

The way I imagine this, we'll need to make `enabled` a property of `RecipeRevision` objects, instead of `Recipe` objects. This makes a lot of the workflows around enabling/disabling a recipe and signing much more complicated. I think that moving Signatures to be per-revision will also be necessary to make this work, but I'm not sure.
